Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I learned a lot of laboratory techniques - Immunhistochemistry, Western Blotting, etc. - for studying human cells and their structures.
A lot about reproductive biology! I havent taken the lecture, but this was a great introduction to the field.
I learned so much about histology and how to perform important lab techniques such as Western blots.
Preparing of histological samples and western blots! Very cool. Also was exposed to many topics in reproductive biology that I had never encountered before.

I enjoyed the chance to take part in an abridged version of the immunohistochemistry and staining that took place in the course. It provided me with a taste for the work that goes on in pathology and gave me a chance to look at interesting samples.
It was really repetitive. It would have been better if we had tried out more techniques.

The final presentations were a really interesting and fun way to apply material learned during the course to human pathology. The lab itself gave us different techniques for studying similar things within the reproductive system, which helped hammer the biology home and also taught me a lot about working in a lab.

Great labs that are well-planned, great instructors, great class environment, great emphasis on student learning. Weaknesses are the labs sometimes get busy and you have to wait around because there is only one or two stations to perform lab tasks.
Great workload but sometimes questions were quite difficult, as we had never talked about it before.
This course is very hands-on and really allows students to learn in an engaging way

It was ideal. Perhaps access to background materials (other than research papers) relevant to the content of weekly labs would be helpful in ensuring students aren't just performing lab skills but also gaining better understanding of reproductive biology (for those students not taking the associated course).

I think the course is great because it is low-stress and allows students to get hands on experience with the coursework. I enjoyed the workload of the course and the group that I was assigned to. I would say that the grading could be improved to allow some mistakes to not have a huge impact on the overall grade.

I would HIGHLY recommend this course to another student. It is chill and has a low but meaningful workload, and Professors Guller and Whirledge are awesome. This course made me want to be a doctor again.

YES! Amazing lab class for seniors in MCDB. Coming in with the relevant knowledge about lab techniques and content made this lab very enjoyable for me. Emphasis on real-world and application, which I very much appreciated.
Absolutely. Dr. Guller and Dr. Whirledge are fantastic people and care about student learning as much as their own fields.
Yes, please take it if you are a senior MCDB major looking for a lab requirement or if you are a premed. You won't regret it.
Great lab class, lowest workload of any others.
